intro: Findlaya apophysata, commonly known as the yellow sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and succulent, fleshy stems. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and high temperatures. Its leaves are usually small, narrow, and covered in a fine layer of wax to reduce water loss. Findlaya apophysata is also known for its ability to thrive in sandy soils, making it a resilient and hardy species.
